author: bchain99
content: have a doubt regarding SSZ: when i encode a struct with a field of type string with fastssz, i get an overflow error, is it because a string is an unbounded type which ssz can't encode? i see most ssz encoded structs as fixed size byte arrays

author: potuz
content: ssz doesn't have the notion of "string", you have either vectors of fixed size, or lists with a limit size (the limit is typically something unrealiistically high, but just there for merklizing purposes. I am assuming that by "string" on fastssz you are thinking on a byte slice, and then you need to merkleize it with an ssz limit.

author: bchain99
potuz
content: no, you need to specify a limit for `field1`, string is not an ssz type

author: bchain99
content: because field1 has no limit in size, i can make field1 a byte slice with an ssz limit which can be provided in the field tags if im right
